intro: Elatostema inaequilobum, commonly known as the unequal-lobed elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the rainy season. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky areas. Elatostema inaequilobum is often found in lowland to mid-altitude regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
